org.jasig.portlet.courses.degreeprogress.mvc.portlet

Class DegreeProgressController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jasig.portlet.courses.degreeprogress.mvc.portlet.DegreeProgressController

  • public class DegreeProgressController
extends java.lang.Object
    Renders the various levels of the ProgressToDegree portlet, including the initial view, the "what if" report, the progress to a "what if" degree, and the progress to a current degree.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0, 2013-04-05
    Author:
    Aaron Grant

      • getMainView

        public ModelAndView getMainView(PortletRequest request)
        Returns both the Model and View inside of a single object which will be displayed to the user. The rendering of the main portlet is dependent on whether or not the user is on a mobile device, and what options they selected.
        Parameters:
        request - A PortletRequest that contains information on how to render the main view of the portlet
        Returns:
        A ModelAndView that holds the model and view to be used with this controller

      • showDegreeProgressForm

        public java.lang.String showDegreeProgressForm(Model model,
                                      PortletRequest request)
        Renders form for a "what if" analysis by the user.
        Parameters:
        model - A Model which holds information for the user to select for a "what if" analysis
        request - A PortletRequest that holds information on how to render the portlet for a "what if" analysis
        Returns:
        "whatIf" if all of the attributes are successfully added; "error" if there is an exception

      • showWhatIfProgress

        public ModelAndView showWhatIfProgress(PortletRequest request,
                              WhatIfRequest whatIfRequest)
        Returns both the Model and View inside of a single object which will be displayed to the user. The rendering of this portlet involves what options the user selected on the "what if" analysis report. The rendering also takes mobile view into account, and will prompt the user with an error if there is missing information.
        Parameters:
        request - A PortletRequest that holds information on how to render the portlet once a "what if" request is received
        whatIfRequest - A WhatIfRequest that holds information on the user's "what if" analysis request
        Returns:
        A ModelAndView that holds the model and view to be used with this controller

      • showDegreeProgress

        public ModelAndView showDegreeProgress(PortletRequest request)
        Returns both the Model and View inside of a single object which will be displayed to the user. This renders the portlet if the user chooses to see their progress towards their current degree. Mobile view is taken into account, and user is prompted with errors if exceptions are made (such as a non-student attempting to access the portlet).
        Parameters:
        request - A PortletRequest that holds information on how to render the portlet to show progress toward the user's current degree
        Returns:
        A ModelAndView that holds the model and view to be used with this controller

      • setMobileDeviceRegexes

        public void setMobileDeviceRegexes(java.util.List<java.lang.String> patterns)
        Parameters:
        patterns - The Strings that hold the given patterns for the regex to match

      • isMobile

        public boolean isMobile(PortletRequest request)
        Parameters:
        request - A PortletRequest that holds information on how to render the portlet
        Returns:
        true if matches a known mobile theme; false if otherwise, and defaults to desktop theme
